comments:
Build: I20061121-1845

This exception occurred during shutdown. An error dialog popped up saying an exception occurred during *startup*, but actually it happened during shutdown.  The log entries follow.  Note that even though there is a !SESSION separator here, both of these errors definitely occurred during the same session.

!ENTRY system.bundle 4 0 2006-11-27 16:25:30.937
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.ComputeNodeOrder
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.StateHelperImpl.sortBundles(StateHelperImpl.java:228)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-11-27 16:25:32.125
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAdaptorMsg
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:184)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:987)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:962)



This exception occurred

I have no idea how this could have happened.  These classes are loaded by a URLClassLoader constructed by the startup.jar not a bundle classloader.  Can you reproduce this easily?  What VM did this happen on?  Maybe the VM ran out of memory and cannot load anymore classes?

VM info:

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142-20050609 (JIT enabled: jitc))

I can't reproduce it with a simple startup/shutdown. I had been running this session all day, so I guess it's possible memory was an issue. There were no other recent exceptions in the log though. 

In case it's of interest, I had been running other workspaces on this same configuration throughout the day.
closing as works for me.  Please reopen if you see the error happen again.
